title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Unable to open a file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor (should display error message)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Unable to open a file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor (should display error message)
OB: When a file is opened in one editor in WSAD (WebSphere Studio Application Developer), attempting to open the same file in another editor does nothing.
EB: When a file is already opened in one editor, and the user tries to open it in another editor, a warning message should be displayed in the workbench, informing the user that they may overwrite changes and asking if they want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed, stating that all files need to be closed first before opening the file in another editor.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. A Notepad or WordPad window will pop up with the java file opened. Close it.
3. Go back to the Java Perspective, open a different java file by simply double-clicking on it. The file is now opened in the workbench.
4. Right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
5. Observe that nothing happens and no warning message is displayed. Expected behavior is that a warning message or error message should be displayed as described in the 'EB' section.
